title: Complexity of finding algebraic dependency of polynomials over the rationals or in a finite field?
body: Let $f_1,\ldots f_m \in K[x_1,\ldots,x_n]$ where $K$ is $\mathbb{Q}$ or a finite field. Q1 What is the complexity of finding all algebraic dependencies between $f_i$ ? Q2 What is the complexity of finding all algebraic dependencies between $f_i$ of degree up to $d$ ? Sage can compute this and I believe it computes first Groebner basis, which is slow. Today I am still waiting for dependency of only six low degree polynomials. Couldn't find the answer with web searching. polynomials computational-complexity Share Cite Improve this question Follow edited Jun 15, 2020 at 7:27 Community Bot 1 2 2 silver badges 3 3 bronze badges asked Oct 27, 2015 at 8:20 joro 25.8k 10 10 gold badges 69 69 silver badges 135 135 bronze badges $\endgroup$ Add a comment  |  0 Sorted by: Reset to default Highest score (default) Date modified (newest first) Date created (oldest first) You must log in to answer this question.
